issue.title: Не работают страницы релизов на online.anidub.com
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

uBlock Origin 1.46.0

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

online.anidub.com

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, EasyList, EasyPrivacy, Peter Lowe's Blocklist, Online Malicious URL Blocklist, RU AdList - Counters, Fanboy's Enhanced Tracking List

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

After enabling/disabling filters, I found that problems with `online.anidub.com` caused by `AdGuard Russian filter` when used by `uBlock Origin` with filters I checked above + 6 built-in uBlock filters.
This issue does NOT appear on root pages: online.anidub.com, online.anidub.com/anime_ongoing, online.anidub.com/anime_tv or online.anidub.com/dorama. It appears only on RELEASES pages (like https://online.anidub.com/anime_ongoing/11560-urusei-yatsura.html)
In uBlock AdGuard Russian filter marked as "external/user filter".

The problem: when `AdGuard Russian filter` enabled, all page content just disappeared, leaving a blank page with AniDub's menu panel at the top of the page.

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

issue.title: epoznan.pl
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://epoznan.pl](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fepoznan.pl) ### Comment Username: @mackowiakw > General Conent Blocker is making websites unscrollable. The problem is caused by removing the policy popup thus it's impossible to click 'Accept'. To be more specific, AdGuard doesn't remove it at all but lefts the invisible layer that covers document body, causing the problem. The problem can be observed on every site which uses Consent Framework by Sirdata (https://www.consentframework.com), eg. https://synonimy.pl ### Screenshots

You mean "didn't unhide it"? That's strange, `@@||youtube.com^$elemhide` should virtually disable most of rules in Other Annoyances filter.
